title: EU delays decision on gas price cap
description: EU energy ministers, still divided, decided to wait until next week to finalise 'technical' details on a natural gas price cap.

title: Argentina and Messi defeat Croatia 3-0 to reach World Cup Final
description: Argentina will meet the winner of Wednesday's semi-final clash between holders France and Morocco in Sunday's final.

title: UK government stokes controversy by authorizing the opening of a coal mine
description: In contradiction to its climate commitments, the UK has approved the extraction of fossil fuel in Whitehaven, northwest England. This is a political move by Prime minister Rishi Sunak, who hopes to appeal to the most conservative MPs.

title: The Ukrainian army must decide how to overcome the Dnipro obstacle
description: Since their withdrawal from the city of Kherson, Russian forces have been camped on the left bank of the Dnipro river. On the other side of the river, the Ukrainian military is trying to decide what strategy to follow to cross the river and make its way to Crimea.

title: War in Ukraine: Macron's lone ranger diplomacy
description: As France holds an international conference in support of Ukraine in Paris, 'Le Monde' looks into the French president's strategy since the beginning of the conflict. Many diplomats and European partners are troubled by his 'solitary' approach.

title: France-Morocco: Walid Regragui, the Atlas Lions' inspiring coach
description: After their superb victory against Portugal, the Moroccans face France on Wednesday. Behind the astonishing determination of the team looms the power of its coach, who was appointed at the end of August.

title: Nice attack trial: Paris court convicts eight suspects
description: The judge's verdict followed more than three months of often heart-wrenching testimony from survivors of the 2016 attack.

title: Three local recipes for Christmas
description: Foie gras, capon, Yule log... For this selection, local produce is best, and meat eaters will not be short-changed.

title: A 'donation' is behind FIFA's withdrawal of complaint against Al-Khelaifi
description: 'Le Monde' has learned that a financial transaction was made to the FIFA Foundation as part of the 'amicable agreement' on FIFA's withdrawal of the corruption complaint against PSG and BeIN Sports boss Nasser Al-Khelaifi.

title: 'Qatargate': Pier Antonio Panzeri, from the Milanese left to European lobbying
description: According to Belgian police, the former chairman of the European Parliament's Human Rights Subcommittee was the driving force behind a Qatar-funded alleged criminal organization suspected of having tried to infiltrate the EU legislative body.

title: German 1970's rock legend Manuel Göttsching dies aged 70
description: As the co-founder of Ash Ra Tempel, one of the reference bands of the 1970's German rock scene, Manuel Göttsching showed a remarkable fluidity and clarity of execution in his guitar playing. He died on December 4, aged 70.

title: World Cup 2022: 'Morocco in the semi-finals, the revenge of the underdogs'
description: Historian Yvan Gastaut analyzes the strong sense of attachment to the Moroccan national team after they qualified for the semi-finals of the World Cup in Qatar.

title: World Cup 2022: Luka Modric, the beating heart of Croatia
description: Against Lionel Messi's Argentina, the Croatian captain will try to earn his country a place in the second final of its history. At 37 years old, he is the embodiment of footballing genius serving a team.

title: How Havas, France's largest PR company, is conducting unofficial diplomacy in Ukraine
description: Olena Zelenska's visit to Paris was discreetly organized by the PR agency that has long worked with Ukrainian billionaire Viktor Pinchuk.

title: French rugby head Laporte convicted less than a year before World Cup
description: Bernard Laporte was convicted for showing favoritism in awarding contracts to his friend Mohed Altrad.

title: French left-wing MP handed suspended prison sentence over domestic abuse
description: Adrien Quatennens, a deputy to left-wing leader Jean-Luc Mélenchon, pleaded guilty and was handed a suspended four-month prison sentence.

title: 'COP15 was not planned to achieve a Paris-style agreement on biodiversity'
description: Former French climate ambassador Laurence Tubiana explains how the fight against climate change has had more time in the political spotlight than the fight to protect Earth's ecosystems.

title: FTX founder Sam Bankman-Fried charged with defrauding crypto investors
description: The US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) charges against Sam Bankman-Fried are separate from the criminal charges expected to be unsealed later Tuesday.

title: Biden courts Africa in Washington summit
description: A three-day United States-Africa summit is to be held against a backdrop of heightened geopolitical competition with China, Russia, and others.

title: Neymar acquitted of corruption over Barcelona transfer
description: A Spanish court acquitted the football star Neymar and his fellow defendants on Tuesday after prosecutors dropped corruption and fraud charges at the end of October.

title: UK readies for massive December strikes over wage grievances
description: Following calls from multiple trade union organizations, more than 1 million British workers are preparing to strike between now and December 31 in order to demand better wages in the face of soaring inflation.

title: 'Qatargate' sends shockwaves throughout Europe
description: President of the European Parliament Roberta Metsola promised to introduce new ethical rules after a corruption case involving one of her vice presidents was uncovered. New searches took place in Brussels on Monday.

title: Northern French seeking euthanasia find legal option in Belgium
description: Demand for euthanasia from patients in France, where euthanasia is not permitted, has led some Belgian institutions to impose restrictions.

title: EU adopts carbon border tax to fight polluting imports
description: The Carbon Border Adjustment Mechanism will apply to imports across several sectors, including steel and aluminum, forcing them to respect EU environmental standards. It will come into effect in 2026 or 2027.

title: France hosts conference for 'urgent' Ukraine winter help
description: The event will gather politicians, companies, and aid agencies to focus on ways in which Ukraine's Western allies can provide immediate assistance to keep the country's civil infrastructure up and running.

title: Angelo Badalamenti, 'Twin Peaks' and 'Blue Velvet' composer, dies at 85
description: The Grammy-winning musician collaborated with the likes of David Lynch, Danny Boyle and Jane Campion.

title: Ant pupae mysterious 'milk' keeps colony health
description: Ant pupae – the stage between the larva and the adult – previously seemed to serve no purpose. A new observation has revealed that its 'milk' actually provides an essential liquid for the development of larvae.

title: A Madrid exhibition shows the iron pact between Pablo Picasso and Julio Gonzalez
description: An exhibition currently showing at the Mapfre Foundation in Madrid displays 170 works by the artist Picasso in collaboration with the metalsmith who introduced him to metal welding.

title: Paris Mayor Hidalgo's financial maneuvers spark controversy even among her allies
description: Local opposition is fuming at Anne Hidalgo's decision to increase the property tax by 52%, while the city's debt is a worry on all sides.

title: Silvio Berlusconi's trial gets set to music in London
description: The spring 2023 production of the musical 'Berlusconi' promises to be a funny and disturbing show, exposing the populism that carried the former businessman to power in Italy

title: Lithium mining: In the Rhine Valley, geothermal 'white gold' brings new hope for climate
description: In Germany as in France, projects to mine the metal that is essential for the manufacture of electric batteries are multiplying. Although they are less polluting than traditional mines and promise almost zero carbon emissions, they are still experimental.

title: Lower prices or secure supply? EU looks to solve gas dilemma
description: On Tuesday, the European ministers will once again try to agree on a mechanism to cap gas prices.

title: Bolsonaro supporters clash with police in Brazil's capital
description: Supporters of Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro attempted to invade the federal police’s headquarters in Brasilia on Monday. They also set fire to several vehicles.

title: Disgraced crypto tycoon Bankman-Fried arrested in Bahamas
description: The arrest comes on the eve of Sam Bankman-Fried's scheduled appearance at a US Congress hearing in which he was to testify under oath about the spectacular collapse of his FTX platform.

title: Industrial investment: Europe is lagging behind China and the United States
description: Asia and North America are picking up the bulk of funding in the technology sectors of the future, a study stresses. The new American protectionist plan could leave Europe further behind.

title: In Russia, the Moskvich makes a triumphant return, under strong Chinese influence
description: In December, 600 vehicles will roll off the production lines of the former Renault factory in Moscow. The rebirth of this mythical car brand from the Soviet era is a success story for the Russian industry and owes much to Beijing.
